serviceServer

Class processor

  • java.lang.Object
    • serviceServer.processor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class processor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is the processor class. It is a web service and acts as a server. It provides the main functionality to the clients. It implements the Serializable class because it is also a java bean and contains accessor methods.
    Author:
    Aysham Hameed
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • makeConnection

        public void makeConnection()
        Used to create a connection to the database using the driver URL and database URL consisting of database username & password.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if cannot find driver class.
        java.sql.SQLException - if database connection is invalid.

      • getTopicID

        public int getTopicID(java.lang.String topicName)
        Used to get the topic ID from database using topic name as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        topicName - parameter used. Example = "Social"
        Returns:
        the ID of the topic. Example = 1
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is a query or connection invalid.

      • getPostCount

        public int getPostCount(java.lang.String topicName)
        Used to get to post count for each topic using topic name.
        Parameters:
        topicName - Example = "Social"
        Returns:
        count Example = 54 (Meaning there are 54 posts for the Social topic.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is a query or connection invalid.

      • doesUserExist

        public int doesUserExist(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String password)
        Checks is the user exists.
        Parameters:
        username - Example : "bruce7"
        password - Example : "1234567"
        Returns:
        code Example : 1 MEANINGS OF CODE: 1 = user found & password correct 2 = user found & password incorrect -1 = user not found
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addUser

        public int addUser(java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String email,
                   java.lang.String password,
                   java.lang.String question,
                   java.lang.String answer)
        Used to add a user to database.
        Parameters:
        username - Example : "bruce7"
        email - Example : "bruce7@gmail.com"
        password - Example : "bruce12345"
        question - Example : "Where did your parents meet?"
        answer - Example : "London"
        Returns:
        returns output code MEANINGS OF OUTPUT CODE: 0 = neutral 1 = user can be added (everything is valid) 2 = user already exists
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • resetPassword

        public int resetPassword(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String email,
                         java.lang.String question,
                         java.lang.String answer)
        Resets user password.
        Parameters:
        username - Example : "bruce7"
        email - Example : "bruce7@yahoo.com"
        question - Example : "Where were your parents born?"
        answer - Example : "London"
        newPassword - Example : "brucecanfly"
        Returns:
        output code. OUTPUT CODE MEANINGS: 1 = everything is correct 0 = neutral -1 = user does not exist -2 = email does not match -3 = question does not match -4 = answer does not match
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:
        username - Example : "bruce7"
        password - Example : "brucecanfly"
        Returns:
        returns OUTPUT CODE: OUTPUT CODE MEANINGS: 0 - neutral 1 - user exists 2 - user does not exists
